author: Special Correspondent
text:
A group of members of the Desiya Thennindhiya Nadhigal Inaippu Vivasayigal Sangam were detained by the city police here on Monday night after they planned to hold a protest in front of the Chief Minister’s residence in Chennai on Tuesday demanding drought relief for farmers.

Sangam members, led by its State president P. Ayyakannu, met the Commissioner of Police Sanjay Mathur at the City Police Office here on Tuesday and demanded that the two Inspectors of Police who had detained them be placed under suspension.

As per their plan, the sangam members planned to stage a protest in front of the Chief Minister’s residence at Poes Garden in Chennai on March 1 demanding drought relief for the farmers.
title: Farmers detained before leaving for Chennai
